comment.text:
My sorority sisters and I had a meeting gathering here and the experience was pretty good. I appreciated the fact that Agave didn't make us wait for our entire party to arrive before seating, a practice many Atlanta restaurants use and can be annoying sometimes. Even though they are located in a cut, they have free valet in their own private lot, which is great, considering space is at a premium in Atlanta nowadays. 

The staff kept our chips and salsa full during our visit. The food came out quickly and did not disappoint. I enjoyed their guacamole and the chile and lime fish tacos. The peachtree margarita was great after a long day of work.

I will return.

photos.caption: Grilled Street Corn and Smoked Salmon Cakes

comment.text:
To be fair, I've only ever come for the tequila dinner, so I'm not totally sure what a typical Agave experience would be like. But I can tell you one thing - I'm sure the margaritas are STRONG. These bartenders know exactly what to do.

The dinner is always changing and seasonal, so it's not typical menu items but I know these chefs also know their stuff. Agave is dressed up Mexican, not casual greasy junk.

Come ready to be wowed! And if you are looking for a fun date idea, I recommend the seasonal Tequila dinner experience. It's a little pricy, but definitely worth it. You will leave full and drunk lol
Really good take on Tex Mex.  Some interesting combos and super big portions.  Margaritas were great.  Guac was amazing.

Had the most terrible experience here. If I could give 0 stars I would. We waited 20 minutes for a table and finally got a terrible table(with a reservation) asked to move tables and got moved to a table in the hallway getting bumped into by servers. Returned 3 horrible margaritas made with what tasted like Mountain Dew before I finally just walked out with my girlfriend. Shortly after we were chased by the manager accused of stealing because we waited long enough to complain before nobody showed up to complain to. Would never recommend this dump of a restaurant to anybody. My dog can make better margaritas. If you want a good margarita come to my house.
I have been eating here for years. The drinks and food are always top notch, and the service is speedy and friendly. See you again In a few weeks

The overall experience was slightly above average. I was with a group of 5 and everyone's food was average. Now, you're probably wondering...why the 4 ma'am? Glad you asked. 

- our waiter was fantastic! He accomodated all of our random requests
- the atmosphere was super cute. 
- the salsa and queso was DELICIOUS!! 

I'll provide my rating of the foods we had:
   - guacomole: average
   - salsa: BOMB
   - queso: BOMB
   - fish tacos: average
   - salmon with asparagus: average
   - pinto beans: average
   - Spanish rice: slightly above average

Solid Mexican food in an extremely nice atmosphere! Let me start by saying I got a "LocalFlavor" aka Groupon equivalent for $15 for $30 worth of food. 

The service: Our server was really cool and seemed very knowledgeable about the menu. Always was swinging by to top off our water, but not an annoying amount. 

The food: Me and my girlfriend agreed that the complimentary chips and salsa was the best we have ever had at any Mexican place and that is saying a ton! I ordered both the Veal Meatballs and the Chicken Quesadilla and my girlfriend got the Verde Pork Enchiladas.

Veal Meatballs- Very tasty meatballs that you could tell weren't just frozen and made real quick, the cheese on top and the salsa/sauce it was in was amazing!

Chicken Quesadilla- This came out hot and delicious and came with plenty of guacamole and sour cream. It was filled to the brim with chicken and cheese, just the way a quesadilla should be.

Verde Pork Enchiladas- A smaller order of enchiladas than most places, but the quality of the pork and cheese it came with was worth the price! 

Overall a great experience with quality food!

photos.caption: Smoked Chicken & Hatch Green Chile Quesadillas (loved the plentiful guacamole and sour cream it came with) also filled to the brim!
Agave Meatballs (not ordered often it seems like, but they were so fresh and delicious I highly suggest them!)

comment.text:
Eh. 

I've wanted to come here forever, but it wasn't worth the wait. Our food came within minutes of ordering...never a great sign. 

Everything was fine. But nothing more. 

The service was friendly but not super attentive. I was without water twice for a while and my food was spicy. 

The margarita was pretty good. I had the smokin hot one, but it wasn't very spicy. 

Overall, I've had better all around. No need to come back, though nothing was bad.
10s across the board, i recommend the crawfish pasta, as well as the strawberry daiquiri that's sure to sneak up on you. I also recommend making a reservation, no matter the day of the week.

Had a great night here for a birthday celebration with a few friends. The food and service was great. Only issue was that there was a used glass at the table (drink residue was still on it). I set it aside to let the waiter know about it. The waiter came around to pour some water, and my friend pointed out that he pouring it into the used glass (I didn't catch it, because I was in a deep conversation). The waiter said that he'd replace the glass, but never did. Aside from that, it was a great experience.

I ordered the Southwestern Shrimp & Poblano Spring Rolls as a starter, the Veal Chorizo & Hatch Green Chile Meatloaf for the entree, a chocolate martini, and I ended it with a Pumpkin Praline Cheesecake for dessert. I enjoyed the meal. The rolls were especially spicy!! The martini was STRONG!

We had a fun time, enjoying great conversation over a great meal. So I would definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: The Veal Chorizo & Hatch Green Chile Meatloaf (Meatloaf, Greens, and Mac N Cheese)

comment.text:
Agave is a must dine for you, and friends when you're in Atlanta. Upon my arrival to the restaurant the host greeted me promptly, and was super nice. I chose covered patio dining for my evening dinner reservation.  

The restaurant feels, and looks like an adobe inside, and it's kept nice, and cool as well. This made for an enjoyable dining experience. My server was Bri, and she was so awesome in rendering great hospitality, had a fun personality, and she made me feel like I was family.

I had a strawberry margarita, and chips, and salsa for starters. The main entree was the fresh chile, and herb rubbed grilled lamb rack. It was served over a New Mexico Guahillo red chile puree atop of Yukon Gold mashed potatoes, and I had a side of seared garlic spinach. The lamb was delicious, and the sides were simply perfect down to the last bite. Need I say more? You must check out Agave for your next dinner reservation.

Thank you for reading, and sharing this blog Dining Today!  For your next dining out experience I hope it's amazing, and make sure you are wearing fantastic accessories from  Diary Talk And More.
I've never had a bad experience. The food is amazing from apps to desserts (speaking of, order the dessert platter and unbutton your pants).

DATE NIGHT 

Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked - Liked 

Made a reservation on Open Table. (Very easy, hosts were expecting us, we were seated fast.) 

Service was great, our waiter was attentive, friendly, helpful and visible. 

Salmon Tostadas -  I liked the dust of spice over top. Tostada strips were light but held up to the tostadas. 

Rack of Lamb - The lamb was perfect, flavorful and very well cooked. The red chile puree didn't really stand out to me or have a lot of flavors but it did not take away from the dish. We got grilled veggies instead of asparagus. 

Chipotle Mashed Sweet Potato - It was very savory, spicy, and lightly sweet. I didn't expect so much spice, but it was true to its name. 

Garlic Spinach - Delicious 

Spicy Peanut Butter Pie - Very Yummy, I could have enjoyed a little more spice but it was still good. 

Great Tequilla Menu- I was able to get an Anejo I liked. 


Disliked - Disliked - Disliked - Disliked - Disliked - Disliked - Disliked 

I wasn't a fan of the Creme Fraiche on the salmon tostada. Personal preference but I was glad there wasn't much on each piece. 

In my Patron Anejo Old Fashion, I wished they'd used an orange. They used lemon and cherry. The drink was still good but it didn't smooth out as I'd hoped. Again, it still was a good mix and I was very excited to see they even had so much tequila to choose from.

So incredibly disappointing. Ordered pickup on a Friday night around 8 PM, so busy but probably not the absolute peak. I called the restaurant when I was outside as parking can be tricky and they advertise curbside, but I was told that I had to come in. I understand that it's hard to have curbside when the restaurant is so busy, but it shouldn't be advertised if it's not offered.

When I did come in, my food was not ready--I was actually advised that they never sent the order to the kitchen. Finally, 20 minutes after standing outside, I got my order. No offer to take anything off the bill or a gift card for next time.

Unfortunately, things got worse from there. The street corn was simply burnt--tasted like nothing but burnt corn. No cheese taste, no spices, nothing. The ahi tuna was tough and also burnt--again, no flavor but burnt tuna. The only redeeming part of the meal was the guac--good flavor and the chips are homemade.

I'm sure this is not the norm for Agave, but this has been one of my more disappointing meals in recent memory.
I order from here regularly and really like it. Great appetizers and entrees. The desserts are good too. The key lime pie is a fave.

Loved it! Had the perfect dinner date tonight at Agave! It was a quiet night in the restaurant, understandably due to Covid. Masks are provided for free if you forget yours in the car like we did. 

When I tell you I had the most delicious piece of salmon... it was moist and seasoned to perfection. The veggies were Mmm good!! The Margarita A1  dessert DELICIOUS and I don't usually do dessert. Guacamole was great as well. 

The waitress was great, knowledgeable about the menu and specials.  Very cozy atmosphere. 

Valet Parking-- no issues there. 

Overall great place for a nice date. 

Will definitely go back!

photos.caption: Red Pepper Salmon Filet. Soooo good!

comment.text: Before COVID-19 I ventured to Agave and the experience was awesome. With the pandemic changing so many things the first thing I noticed was the food was bland and had no flavor but the alcoholic beverages had plenty of flavor. The seafood was over cooked and chewy like rubber and I noticed that other people were complaining as well, so I didn't mind sending my food back to be remade. I don't know if it was a bad night but I got sick from it , maybe it was the crawfish that smelled fishy don't know. I'll give it sometime before I return.

photos.caption: Smoking Hot Margaritas   Lunazul "Humoso" Smoked Tequila, Jalapeno, Fresh Lime, & Sour on the rocks

comment.text: Amazing experience. Saw this place as we were driving by and stopped in. Lucked out and was able to get a table. My husband had the Santa Fe Blue Corn Enchiladas, I had the Seared Diver Scallops and my son had the Mesa Quesadilla. Every bite was amazing along with our waiter, James.

user.name: Joanne J.
user.address: Upper West Side, New York, NY

comment.text: Made a reservation for a Thursday night. The restaurant was quite packed. Got the crawfish pasta and the portion was huge and tasty. Also got a strawberry cheesecake to go because I was stuffed after dinner. The cheesecake did not disappoint as well.

Located in the cut behind Oakland Cemetary this place is truly a hidden gem. I came for a girls night out and the entire experience was amazing! 

The atmosphere of this place was so cozy, quaint, and quiet, it was a total Spain vibe. My friends and I sat in their "outdoor" area but it was basically enclosed which we were grateful for since it was v cold outside. Our server was so attentive and educated on the menu, and that's important!! 

The food was absolutely delicious with large sized portions. But one thing to point out - their grits. Listen, not everyone can do grits right, but these people CAN! 

The parking lot is complimentary valet - but to be honest it so isn't needed. The parking lot is not that big nor is it that far from the restaurant. I definitely don't think they needed that but alas, prepare yourself for that.

Although the food is good, the wait is terrible and their portions are insulting... 26$ for lamb rack w one spoonful of  mashed potatoes and three asparagus
My husband ate it in 5 min

I seriously can't believe I've never wrote a review for this place. It's one of my favorite places to dine in the city and I've been coming here for years! It's a southwestern themed restaurant that's intimate and has the most amazing tequila selection.

My favorite items are the crawfish pasta, peachtree margarita, spring rolls , calamari and the NY strip. Their homemade salsa is also one of the best I've ever had. I order the crawfish pasta 90% of the time because it's AMAZING. The cream sauce in the pasta is so delicious and they don't skimp on the crawfish. I like to bring people here because of the variety of items on the menu. There's literally something for everyone. They also have a vegetarian menu.

They offer specials throughout out the week including $12 entrees from 5-6 M-F, 2 for 1 apps at the bar during the same time and 10% off of your bill on the weekends (with email). It's seriously a great establishment with awesome food, delicious drinks and great staff.

First I want to commend the service we received here. Keith (I hope I remembered that name correctly) was our server. We had a table of 12 and some of my dining companions are not the easiest people to go out to eat with. Keith never missed a beat. Always there when we needed him. I think there was a mixup of items on the checks at the end and one margarita that was forgotten, but really when we ordered over 30 dishes and over 30 drinks all at random times and with people shouting over the table at him their order and everything made it, I think he did amazing. 

The food itself was outstanding. The meatloaf and meatballs were the best meatloaf and meatballs I had ever had. I tried other appetizers as well and thought everything was very good. Two things I thought were just ok was the free salsa they gave us and the pasta someone ordered. However, everyone else at the table raved at the pasta so maybe it just wasn't my preference. 

The restaurant space is not big but is very well decorated and comfortable. I really liked the open kitchen. I love watching professionals cook. Our table didn't have the best view of it. I would love to come back and sit at the bar or upstairs and watch them more. 

Overall it was a very good experience and would definitely love to come back and try even more next time.

Love love love. The braised short rib is great. So are the pork chops. 

I've always had a great experience except the very last time I went. The waitress refused to substitute out sweet potatoes (I'm allergic) and said I could either take them to go or not get them at all. 
It's a $28 meal.. with no side because she wouldn't substitute.

 I'll definitely be back but if it's her--I'll be asking for another waitress. 

Other than that--give it a go! Great restaurant.

Concerning Agave, I'm here to tell the world this one thing. You never would believe this, but it so happens that grits, scallops, and collard greens go very well together. I discovered that at Agave. I pass this place when I take the back roads from downtown. It looks sketchy from the outside, but it's always packed. 
I finally went in, and it's fine on the inside. 
I really enjoyed their take on chips and salsa and I really liked the ceviche. However, I did not like the key lime pie. It tastes like the ones from the grocery store.

I'm from Cali so I'm particular about my Mexican food. But this is "Southwestern Food." A nice alternative. I went here for a business meeting and have been back on my own half a dozen times. Blue corn enchiladas and chorizo meatballs are delicious!

This has been one of my favorite restaurants in Atlanta for longer than I can remember. One of my favorite things about it has been recommending it to some of my favorite  people over the years and having them fall in love too. I made a believer out of 4 favorites, 2 of which are VERY picky eaters on 10/31. I couldn't stop exclaiming how happy I was that everyone loved their meals for days!!! Thank you Agave for ALWAYS bringing consistently FRESH, AMAZING flavor to your guests again and again!!!

This is one of my favorite restaurants. The food is always good and they honestly have the BEST margaritas in town. Tonight I ventured out and tried something new which was the stuffed trout. It was very tasty and I highly recommend it. My mom has the rack of lamb and she  was very pleased with her choice.

photos.caption: Belgian Chocolate Mousse with a Creme Angliase

comment.text: Atmosphere is good as well as food. Definitely remains on list of go to spots. Love the fried lobster appetizer.

Celebrated my birthday here and Agave never disappoints. I highly recommend the Top Shelf Margarita - Agave does not hold back on the tequila! The fried lobster special was an excellent choice & extremely delicious. And the steak...seasoned to perfection! I cannot wait to go back.

The food was delishness!!!!!!

Mac and cheese side - yummy and cheesy! For drinks we had passion fruit margarita. We were seated right away but probably bc ppl are holding back from stepping to the outdoors due to corona virus typically it's reservation only. The ambience was casual fun dimmed
Lights. The complimentary appetizer chips and salsa was very fresh and delicious. The food we ordered was not only good it was so flavorful, hot and fantastic! Will definitely be back again!!! Oh...the drinks were very good not great but that is just my opinion which is why I gave 4/5 stars.

photos.caption: Sweet mash with short ribs and mash with lamb chops!
Short back ribs with sweet mash and lamb chops with mash.

comment.text: Everything was so good! The Hatch Green Chile Stew was one of the most delicious things I've ever tasted. We also really enjoyed The Smoked Chicken and Hatch Green Chile Quesadilla, The Barbacoa, and The New Mexico Burrito. Highly recommend!

Established in October of 2000 and set in the historic Cotton Mill general store, Agave has been named the Best Southwestern Restaurant in Atlanta, Georgia.
The Native American ambience is warm & welcoming. A cozy little spot that is filled with the smells of fresh southwestern spices. I glance over the menu and decide on the Stuffed Mountain Trout. Fresh Georgia mountain trout stuffed with crawfish, mushrooms, onions, & basil over Spanish rice with a roasted tomatillo sauce & freshly cut cilantro. With every bite I enjoy the freshly caught seafood dressed in tomatillo and freshly picked cilantro. I have to meet the genius of this mouth watering creation. My server is nice enough to bring the chef over to receive compliments from the patron who has devoured this amazing dish. O reccomend Agave twice over......

photos.caption: Honey, Cider & Smoked Bacon Collard Greens

comment.text:
We've all passed by this place numerous times and said: "hey, I've gotta try that place one day". Well, my day finally came. We happened to be in the neighborhood on a Sunday around 5pm so it was a no-brainer. 

Parking was easy; they have a lot with a complimentary valet. 
We got there around 5:45pm and without reservations, were seated immediately. As soon as we were seated Numb by Zhu started playing and I knew it was going to be a good time. Their playlist rivals some DJs. 

Our server was prompt with impeccable timing. The kitchen was quick and precise. My brother's steak was cooked to a perfect medium while I had a veal and chorizo meatloaf with collards and mac 'n cheese that was stupid good. 

I think labeling this as a Tex-Mex place is a disservice to the culinary prowess of the chefs. Mexican Fusion is more accurate. They took a boring, southern classic and turned it into something altogether unique. 

The range of flavors in the meatloaf, and the texture. My God, the texture! Like a hot knife through butter. The collards were slightly sweet, a welcome surprise, not better or worse than the traditional way of cooking them - just different. And the mac 'n cheese...DISCLAIMER: I'm super bougie when it comes to mac 'n cheese (if that wasn't already apparent by my abbreviating "and" with 'n) so I was thinking, "Tex Mex mac 'n cheese, this is going to be terrible".  Never have I been so wrong! Well, maybe thinking the Falcons would win the SuperBowl but that wound is still too fresh...I digress...

In summation; Agave is awesome! Go there and put food in your mouth hole. 

Oh, but avoid the flan - the flan is horrible.

Really nice restaurant. A nice date spot and actually that night I was there someone was getting engaged. The food was tasty and the deserts are super sweet. The fireplace in the restaurant keeps the areas nice a warm but not too hot. The bar was busy with a lot of people but it appeared that everyone were enjoying themselves. I am going to visit again and you should also!!!

My husband and I have driven passed this restaurant over the years and we finally decided to try it out. The food was so good, our waiter was super awesome, and atmosphere was nice as well. We added this restaurant to our restaurant list. The drinks was super good too. Loved it!!!!

TLDR: Hatch green chiles. Get them here.

Agave is a Southwestern/New Mexican restaurant. Yelp currently lists it as 'Tex-Mex', but that is incorrect (change submitted but I'm not hopeful - ETA: my change was rejected).

It's also one of the many places I've been to in Atlanta going on many years but have failed to review. The Atlanta Cuisine food forum crowd (RIP) used to come here a lot back in the day, sipping margaritas at the small bar, and Tom Maicon (the force behind Atlanta Cuisine) has touted the restaurant since its inception.

Rightfully so, I think. Agave's kitchen creates a fairly wide menu of southwestern dishes, many using the Hatch chile, the best of its kind in the world. You won't find screaming hot food here, although New Mexico is known for that. Instead, the flavors are more balanced and subtle.

- Margaritas: one the main draws here.The margaritas are top notch and if you don't see one that exactly fits your mood, they'll make one that will. My wife asked for something 'not sweet' and was promptly served up a margarita that was heavy on the tequila and lime and light on the sugary liqueur. I prefer the Herradura Top Shelf, with salt of course.

- Chips n salsa: complimentary and good

- Guacamole: very good, although the 'full' order could be fuller.

- Chile relleno: unlike any other I've had, Agave's version is a steak relleno light on the cheese. Excellent. Fairly large, too.

- Rolled fish tacos: unusual in that they're rolled, they also are not the big, stuffed puppies you get elsewhere (such as down the road a piece at Six Feet Under). Tasty.

- Cayenne Fried Chicken: I'm stretching my memory for this one but I recall being happy with it. I'll have to try it again soon.

The bar is not large but it's the place to be if there's only two of you, or you're by yourself. Starters are two for one between 5 - 7 and you'll want to arrive early to get a seat.

Bartenders are great.

Rounding up on this one from 4.5 to 5 stars. I like Agave.

photos.caption: The 'Good & Strong' margarita, not on the menu. No sugary ingredients.

comment.text: Went to Agave Restaraunt on Sat night 12/26/2020. My party of 5 had an 8:15 reservation for a birthday dinner & I arrived on time, but they did not get there till about 8:35. That was no problem & we were immediately seated upon arrival. Our waiter, Malcolm was nice, but did not check on our table as frequently as I would have liked. We ordered drinks & my friends liked theirs but mine ( Peach Margarita) was a bit watery for me. I asked Malcolm for a Hennessy Margarita instead, like my friend got. It took about 20 mins to get the new drink but it was good when I finally received it. I got the spring rolls for an appetizer & the porkchop dinner. The spring rolls came with 2 nice dipping sauces which really added a nice flavor. The meal itself was nice, although nothing spectacular. The porkchop tasted good & the collard greens & mashed potatoes were satisfying. Again, not spectacular. Overall, we enjoyed our meal, but it was mostly due to the company I was with rather than the food & service. The restaurant was not crowded at all & I ultimately thought Malcolm could have done better with actually remembering to bring back the items we requested in a more timely fashion. I would probably not return, but you should check it out & see for yourself!

photos.caption: Spicy Grilled Pork Chop w/ collard greens, mashed potatoes & onion rings.

comment.text:
I came here with the Meetup group I organize, 8 or 9 ladies. They either lost my reservation or I didn't do something right, but they were able to seat us upstairs fairly quickly even though it was a busy Thursday night. It was like we had a cool VIP view of the restaurant! 

The service, however, was EXTREMELY slow. It felt like we were being ignored. It took almost a half an hour for our drink orders to even be taken. We had to keep trying to flag our server down, which was hard because we were separate from the rest of the restaurant. 

The food was good, but I think they should pay more attention to having quality ingredients cooked well than creativity and having a huge menu (which is definitely on point). The veal/chorizo meatballs are amaze-balls (har har). I would come back just for those. My huge barbacoa and chorizo taco was good, but I could have done with more sauce, it was a bit dry on top. My feeling is that if you can't pick up the taco, it should be covered in sauce. 

Loving all the hatch green chile appearances. 

Hating their lack of spicy sauces and things that claim to be spicy, but are just not (spicy jalapeño margarita, spicy chicken, smoking hot margarita). They did give me some fresh Serranos, which helped some. 

I appreciate all the specials they have. Groupon, Seated, etc.

Agave is an interesting review for me. Our sever who was the bartender was absolutely lovely. Great presence and suggestions. Drinks were really good including the wine which was a surprise at a tequila bar.

Food was pretty good. We ordered the ceviche which missed the mark. Shrimp were hard and rubbery. But the meatballs were wonderful and the short ribs really good too. 

The one thing that offended me was the tip suggestions on our pay stubs. The low percent was twenty and high end was 30. 30%! I routinely tip anywhere from 20 to 25% for good service sometimes higher if it's outstanding. But Ive NEVER had a restaurant suggest 30% is within the realm of normal. What that tells me is as a restaurant you are shouldering the burden of inflation on your patron instead of paying your employees correctly. This infuriates me. Pay you're employees! My tip should never be factored in as 30% of your employees pay. The end
horrible food - the salmon was obviously canned, the shrimp were old (maybe frozen?), and even the enchiladas were bad. they are also understaffed. will never be back.

Had the opportunity of having dinner here on a Thursday night which I might add was very packed. We made reservations so we were seated immediately. The ambience was a little dark and noisy, but that may be just the way it is. 

The table comes with chips and salsa that were pretty good, especially the salsa. I ordered the pork chop ....Rancho Grilled it said. It was cooked very nicely but it was missing a tasty sauce. The mashed potatoes and asparagus were ok sides, nothing special.

I have been going to Agave since I moved to Atlanta over 10 years ago and it has always been consistent. I have never had bad service and their food has always been impeccable. I think I may have tried everything on the menu and every time I go there I have a hard time deciding what to eat.

Agave is located across the street from the Oakland Cemetery. As far as parking it is all free valet (free obviously with a tip , poor guys were running their butts off in the rain last time we went, so bring a little cash!)

I usually get the scallops which melt in your mouth like butter and they are served with grits and collard greens. The last time I felt like splurging so I ordered the NY Strip with mashed potatoes. The NY Strip was so TENDER. I ate the whole thing. I NEVER eat that much food. As you can see from the picture this was a pretty big steak

Other recommendations get the guacamole!!! And a margarita. And don't forget about dessert, I always get a chocolate dessert (last time was the chocolate mousse, the whipped cream had cinnamon in it!) with a nice, cream sherry. Yum!

photos.caption: All Natural Chile Grilled NY Strip Steak
Belgian Chocolate Mousse with a Creme Anglaise

comment.text:
I enjoyed my visit here but Agave just doesn't stand out to me and there are plenty of restaurants in Atlanta that offer Tex-Mex as well as the authentic Mexican restos.
Their margaritas can use some tequila, too.

For my app I tried tuna and shrimp ceviche - it was OK, a bit too acidic for my taste. 

My main dish: seared scallops with tomato grits and grilled asparagus. Very well prepared. 

Overall: attentive service, very cozy atmosphere, tons of tequilas, valet or street parking, decent menu choices. Worth a try if in the area

One of my favorite Mexican inspired restaurants. They have one of the BEST tequila bars in Atlanta. The staff is friendly. I had a birthday dinner there years ago and they provided some of the best service.

I've been here a few times, and each experience has been great! Their happy hour menu is fantastic, but only applies to food not drinks.But the drinks are reasonably priced.  They open at 5, and bet 5-6 entrees are $12! Between 5-7 all apps (including salads) are buy one get one free! But you must be at the bar and it is SMALL!! There are literally 11 seats at the bar! And as the night goes on you literally have lots of ppl standing behind you waiting for a seat at the bar. What wonderful, varied menu items! You can't go wrong with anything off the menu. My favs are the guacamole, scallops, egg rolls, and fried lobster tails. The margaritas are also amazing. Another cool tip, they sell these metal straws for $1. I was told that they no longer have straws due to being eco-friendly.

photos.caption: A wonderful margarita for $7.50!! Metal straw is $1

comment.text: Food and service were good. They need to fix their parking lot; however, the valet parking was ok.

eat spot a little off the beaten path in Atlanta. Perfect for visitors or locals looking for a great new spot for Mexican/Southwestern cuisine. This is a restaurant best suited to adults, in my opinion, although we did see kids there. 

The menu is packed with more dishes than you can imagine, making this a much more enjoyable dinner than the traditional Tex-Mex located in your nearby shopping mall. Our group sampled everything from Tacos, to steak, and even wings (for the diner who doesn't enjoy Mexican food). The great news is that there is something for everyone, including dishes you may have never tried before.
We will definitely dine here again, looking for a five-star experience. If you want Mexican, I would give Agave a try

photos.caption: Steak All Natural Chile Grilled NY Strip Steak plus Tenderloin Medallions

comment.text: If you want to make your taste buds do the salsa, you have to get the pork chop. It was incredible. So flavorful and perfectly spicy. Also got the good, but strong margaritas and the waiter wasn't lying... it was exactly that! Perfect spot for a date night.
We'be been to Agave a few times now and have had relatively positive experiences. The Lamb and the chicken burrito were both great. The drinks were hit or miss for our table.
